Posts.Content: May 31, 2019 10:45AM Sparkles2_2 wrote: WOW there is a whole thread for us Oligo's WHOOHOO... My story, Diagnosed originally as a stage III until a bone scan showed 1 single Met to T5 which changed me to a Denovo stage IV back in late 2017. I had Chemo- than a lumpectomy and a pile of radiation. My single Met to T5 was zapped via Cyber knife last fall and I have been NED ever since. Im on preventative treatments now to keep it at bay. But i am feeling good!
Posts.Title: Thread for Stage 4 Oligometastic Folks KelQ time-for-a-cure

Posts.Content: May 31, 2019 12:09PM Sparkles2_2 wrote: One thing I want to add- for me especially is Your to young to have mBC, apparently not seeing as I have it and I am 38- soon to be 39 and was diagnosed at 37.
Posts.Title: Myths/Misconceptions about MBC- please share with us! Moderators Sparkles2_2
